You don't have to call me darlin', darlin'. But you never even call me by my name. [spoken] This is a song I wrote with John Prine 4 years ago (1972) and we tried to put into one song, everything that had ever been in any of the country and western songs we had ever heard. Tried to put it all into one song. But you never even call me by name. [musical by mouth improv done in a Merle Haggard-like tone-no words]. [spoken] I've seen my name, a few times in the phone book. [spoken] And on the neon sign above the bar I used to own. [spoken] And there's only one thing I'm really sure of was that sucker.
